I like typing indicators but I find them very visually distracting as the indicator appears, disappears, appears, etc. The conversation pushes up, then back down, etc, which draws my attention thinking a new message has arrived.

My suggestion is to eliminate the bubble around the 3 dots and have the 3 dots appear in the gap between the most recent message and the edit box, without moving the conversation up and down in the process.

I agree. However, if this is implemented I would also suggest ensuring that the dots are large enough to draw attention, and possibly giving the dots a red border or some other flashy color.

The color of the border of the dots could even be the color set for the conversation (would be very cool visually). the border of the dots should also be large enough to be noticed.

Just to ensure I’m clear: visually, this would like two concentric disks having almost the same radius, with the inner one being slighty smaller. The outer disk is the border, having the flashy color.

It would be great to see the “typing” indicator be sticked to the group header itself, currently you get to see the contact dp in the message window while they are typing. Imagine you have a whole lot of users online trying to text…

Typing indicators are nice, but actually I‘m more interested in the result - the message! As they are right now typing indicators are fine …

This was noted before:

Show Other Users Typing? Feature Requests
I apologize if this has been brought up already but in a group it will only show that one person is typing at a time, even if multiple people are typing at once. I found an animation on dribbble of how the typing indicator in a group should work. Thanks so much for the typing indicator feature! It is enjoyed by myself and the people I convinced to use Signal. I know this group thing is minor, but having groups show everyone that is typing at a given time would be appreciated.

Please keep the discussion there.

I think this request is okay on its own, as the other request is simply for the addition of typing indicators, which have been implemented for a long time and the request is marked as solved.

However, I don’t think the idea is a great one; it makes more sense to me to have the typing indicators where they currently are, and as far as I know, that is where all other messaging apps have them.

The WhatsApp typing indicators are in the group/conversation header, at least on android and desktop/web.

One problem with Signal’s typing indicators as they are on desktop (haven’t actually seen them on android yet as I’ve only had the app a few days) is that Person A typing creates an indicator at the bottom of the conversation, which moves the rest of the conversation up. If you or any other person in the group starts sending messages whilst Person A is typing, your message appears above their typing indicator which seems counter intuitive. (That is, new messages being inserted above a typing indicator feels weird)

Also personally, when using the desktop app on a second screen, I see the conversation move and their coloured typing indicator block appear as if someone has sent a message and it grabs my attention, even though no message has been sent. And that person might not even end up sending the message.

I find the typing indicators nice, but a little too distracting. Would prefer more subtle ones, that don’t look like messages. What I would go for is the same animated ellipses/3 dots in a coloured block, but in a fixed/absolute position within the conversation window where it doesn’t move the conversation.

I agree with @gazm2k5
the continuous moving of the whole conversation is really annoying.
A better solution, like the one he is proposing, should be considered at some point

Messages showing up after the typing indicator seems weird to me… they’re currently typing, so it’s the “latest” status (even newer than the message you just sent) and when they do eventually send the message it will appear after the message you sent and not at the point that the typing indicator originally was. So it makes sense to me to always keep the indicator at the end of the conversation.

gazm2k5:

Also personally, when using the desktop app on a second screen, I see the conversation move and their coloured typing indicator block appear as if someone has sent a message and it grabs my attention, even though no message has been sent. And that person might not even end up sending the message.

I think the distracting nature of typing indicators has been mentioned around here before, and while it doesn’t bother me, I can see where that is coming from. As a workaround, you could disable them, but that obviously means you no longer know when others are typing (and it also prevents others from seeing that you are typing).

Herohtar:

Messages showing up after the typing indicator seems weird to me

Yes agree too! I didn’t meant to imply that would be less weird. The typing indicators appearing as chat messages is the weird part, they should be separate to the messages.

From a design perspective, as I mentioned, this is undesirable:

  1. Partly because the chat bubble implies a message is coming but sometimes the user chooses not to send the message.
  2. Partly because other users sending message get inserted above the typing indicator
  3. Annoying because the rest of the conversation moves up and down repeatedly when people start and stop typing.

I think having the same indicators but in an absolute/fixed position at the top left or right would be fine.

It feels rather more logical to me, as a message that is actively being written is per definition always newer than any other already finished message.

I don’t know about that. In a group where messages are being frantically sent, sometimes Person A can be typing a message, but then Person B and C send messages before Person A can send their reply… and maybe Person A sees this and deletes their message because maybe Person B or C said what they were going to say, or gave them new information so Person A’s message wasn’t needed.

Person A’s unsent message wasn’t necessarily newer or older than the messages from person B or C… it was just obsolete and the typing indicator should never have appeared as a chat bubble within the conversation in my opinion.
